text: Staff was super friendly and knowledgable! Assisted, directed, and explained when questions were asked. Clean and well organized with a plethora of items!

I  am neither a family friend or a relative of any of the employees. I have used this company several times and have always had excellent service. Jesse was our tech today and he could not of been any more helpful. All the times I have used this company I have never felt as if they were pushing something on me to buy or repair that didn't need it. Also, my parents who are elderly had an issue with their furnace last winter. As always you  got to worry about people taking advantage of seniors on stuff like this. . I did not have this concern when I suggested they used this company. They treated them very well and did not take advantage of them one bit. They were extremely happy as was I.

This family-owned gem is fantastic! Everything was delicious, especially the lamb korma. Everything I ate was a different experience. It has the feeling of eating at a friend's house, but only the kind of friend who is a great host. The owners are extremely welcoming. For newcomers to Indian cuisine, the owners were very helpful in explaining how best to compliment what dish with which sauce and explain the overall Indian cuisine experience. You can really taste the love in every bite.

Best Chinese food in Phoenix! I love Chinese food, and I've tried numerous Chinese food restaurants across the valley comparing various dishes. Sun Asian Kitchen is clearly the best. My favorite is the beef egg foo young. The place looks great too. Very friendly staff. I come here as often as I can.
I had ear problems for years that went ignored. After an ear wax extraction, I could swim without my ears clogging.

This place is one of my favorites. Very low cost for such quality and quantity. I don't often get full for so little money, but I was completely stuffed after I finished my meal. The Philly cheese steak was delicious; every bite satisfied my taste buds. This is one of those places where you are gonna wanna try everything on the menu.
The sandwiches are great and the vibe is good. I highly recommend the French dip it was probably the best one I've ever had

The place has amazing noodle bowls! I had the house special and it was delicious. The staff was extremely friendly and let me know what was in every dish. They even have Boba tea! I had the high Thai tea and it was top notch.  My friend had the California poke bowl and it was really fresh. You can even pick your own ingredients for your bowl!

Food was amazing!!! I had the scallop starter which where the best scallops I've ever had they were a great size , for the main T-bone steak which just broke off the bone was absolute quality! We had a side of mixed cauliflower which was cooked beautiful! Would defo recommend this restaurant but must book in advance!
Dr. Smith removed a cyst from my son's nose and cheek and left no scar whatsoever.  Great job on my boy.  It was miraculous.

Dr. Simpson is the most caring and capable Chiropractor out there.  The front office people are so kind and helpful I could not wait to come back for more treatments.  After an hour in Dr. Simpson's hands, I felt like a new man.  There is also a massage therapist on site and they will take care of all your neck and back needs. All I needed was a simple alignment, and I felt 25 years younger and had lots more energy the next day....after a good nights sleep.  Highly recommend these guys!
Good quality sushi a little heavy on the wasabi. But for me very overpriced but I guess that's Vegas.

If I could give it 0 stars I would.   Absolute worst service we have ever experienced.  Didn't receive all of our food ordered, asked 5 times and still didn't receive it and then she brought us our check still without receiving all our food.  No apologies just a nasty look on the girls faces.  We paid exact change and left.  Apparently made enough in tips from other people to get their boobs done but we definitely won't be back.  Sad because it was always our favorite every time we come here. Monte carlo needs to take charge

I agree with the last reviewer, Coco is the BEST i have seen yet! 
Man o man, she can dance, act, is freakin' hilarious and has one of the hottest bodies I have seen on stage ever.
And in contrary to Holly, this version with Coco is extremely topless in the beginning and pretty much throughout the whole finale.
So glad they finally got a star that is a real Vegas headliner. We did the VIP option and Coco actually talked to us for a while after the show. Unlike  Holly who just gave us an autograph and pushed us on our way after 30 secs.
Big fan of all the supportings. Everyone was funny, fantastic singers, and the dance sets and numbers were on fire! Very sexy and entertaining show.
You can tell Coco is a dancer cause man she has the moves! I wanna see her on Dancing with the Stars next!

Destination wedding made easy! When my husband and I decided on a destination wedding we knew we needed help with travel. After getting about 500 quotes (more like 10-15) we decided to go with the travel network as they not only came back with the best quote but were fast to reply and easy to communicate with. Ashley O'Connor was our travel agent and she really is amazing! She took care of everything for us, dealt with all of our 34 guests and sorted out every issue that we encountered. She is great at responding to emails and calls, worked for us (when it seemed like Air Canada was against us) and coordinated travel for our guests in 3 provinces, BC, Alberta and Ontario (everyone arrived the same day and the cost was pretty close for everyone which we found amazing) I recommend going with the Travel Network and working with Ashley if you want a stress free getaway made easy.

Went to Alleycatz on a Friday for dinner after we purchased a groupon for a 3 course meal. Service was good and by the time we left at 9:45pm it was packed. The food however was just ok, all 3 courses we nothing special and by the time we paid for drinks, plus the added in tip, and tax it was a $130 meal. For that price we've definitely gotten way better food around Toronto.

Reesa was FANTASTIC. Very welcoming, talked me through the process, and did exactly what I wanted. I got something in my mother's handwriting and she did it exactly as it was on the sheet I gave her. Love my tattoo! The receptionist and apprentice working that day were also great and very efficient with paperwork and aftercare. Love this place!

DO NOT Rent Here Unless you want to be oversold and undervalued 

My tenancy at Sycamore at Scottsdale has not been long but has been quite disappointing. In 6 years of renting apartments in the Phoenix Metropolitan area, my tenancy at this complex has by far been the most dissatisfying. 
 
I moved into a 1 BR apartment late Oct of 2013 and experienced issues with the unit from day one. The unit I moved into was promoted as an upgraded unit with brand new appliances, countertops and cabinetry. Unfortunately those promotable items ended up being the only pieces of the unit functional or satisfying. The rest of apartment seemed to have significant issues that were either overlooked or quickly patched during re-construction to sell the unit. Within the first couple of weeks I noticed a number of issues with the apartment and relayed those concerns to management. 
 
Some of the issues included a washer/dryer stackable unit that only released hot water and that did not dryer most likely as a result of being overused and outdated, a toilet that run water for nearly one minute after flushing and dispels a foul odor akin to mold regardless of how often it is clean, a ceiling fan in the living room that shakes dangerously when turned on, and a floor that vibrates uncontrollably for extended periods of time throughout the day. These concerns are matters that should have been taken care of prior to moving a tenant into the unit but nonetheless they were brought to management's attention. Initially the matters seemed to priority of the management but  soon I learned that my expressed concerns were of little importance to management and my satisfaction as a tenant was irrelevant. 

I spoke to management a total of three (3) times and still have yet to see a resolution to any of the matters. Each time maintenance comes to the unit they claim to address issue yet nothing has been fixed or even modified and management has not shown much concern to the matter. The toilet still had the same issue due to an inaccurate analysis by maintenance, the washer/dryer still had not been serviced properly and the floor still vibrates noticeably throughout the day. The head of maintenance even came to the unit and promised to resolve all the issues but that was over a month ago and nothing has been fixed. 

 As a result of this lack of care, concern and professionalism regarding the issues in the unit I have requested to vacate the unit early. Instead of addressing the issues and adjusting their approach to keep me as a satisfied tenant management chooses to contest me on what fees I should pay as a result of my lease termination. The property management wants me to pay a fee to break the lease even though it comes as a response and a result of their lack of care and professionalism. A lack of care for quality by overlooking or patching maintenance concerns in order to sell quickly. And lack of professionalism by not promptly resolving those concerns yet lying about doing so. I have attempted to collaborate with management to vacate amicably since the maintenance concerns are of little importance to them but instead they choose to lobby for me to pay for their lack of attentiveness and professionalism. 

I am even being asked to pay an extra nine (9) days worth of rent after my letter to vacate indicated and management agreed upon. Management further attempted to overcharge me for December's rent for an overdue charge that they still cannot explain or validate its origin. If matters had been addressed prior to me moving in the unit or even promptly once brought to their attention I would have been much happier with my experience in the complex and would not been forced to move on. However the management seems to be only concerned with selling units not providing potential tenants with homes up to standard quality of living. 
 
Overall I would say my tenancy at Sycamore at Scottsdale has been abysmal. The management of the complex seemed to be satisfied with over selling and under delivering; my business only seemed to be valued to sell a unit. This has been the worst experience in my rental history and would not recommend this complex to anyone any time in the future.
